item.title: Predator Prey cycles
item.description: Hare lynx cycle lynx-hare-cycle hare–lynx cycle described by Lotka–Volterra equations \(\dfrac{dV}{dt} = rV - aVP \) and \(\dfrac{dP}{dt} = -qP + baVP\). Here V is hare density; P is lynx density; t marks time such that dV/dt gives the rate of change in the hare density and dP/dt similarly for lynx; r, a, b and q are parameters thatdetermine how quickly hares reproduce (r), how many hares are eaten (a) for a given density of lynx and hare, how efficiently eaten hares are converted into lynx offspring (b) and how quickly lynx die when food is in short supply (q).
